intro: Clermontia clermontioides var. hirsutiflora, commonly known as the hirsutiflora Clermontia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, hairy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
